alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 07 at 1:12AM CST until March 07 at 1:45AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Clay County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Dunklin County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 145 AM CST. * At 112 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chalk Bluff Natural Area, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Malden, Piggott, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Holcomb, St. Francis, Pollard, McDougal, Saint Francis, Glennonville, Crockett, Tipperary, Hickoria, Valley Ridge, Providence, Morris State Park, Wilhelmina, Brian and Chalk Bluff Battlefield Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for eastern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 AM CST for southeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
